security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing example configurations and templates for network security setup. All code is embedded in markdown code blocks as documentation examples with no actual executable code or file operations. Purpose matches capabilities.

content.value_statement: Claude Code sandbox needs secure network configuration to prevent unauthorized access while allowing trusted domains. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for configuring firewall rules, trusted domains, and access policies.
actual_capabilities: Audit network requirements and external dependencies
Design network security policies with whitelist approach
Implement firewall rules and DNS filtering
Configure environment variables for network settings
Test access controls and validate policies
limitations: Does not modify actual system firewall rules
Requires manual execution of configuration scripts
Cannot verify network policies without actual deployment

use_cases.title: Configure firewall rules
use_cases.description: Set up iptables firewall policies to control inbound and outbound network traffic for Claude Code sandbox.

use_cases.title: Define trusted domains
use_cases.description: Create whitelist of trusted domains like GitHub, npmjs, and PyPI for secure external access.

use_cases.title: Document security policies
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive documentation for network security configuration and deployment procedures.

output_examples.input: Set up network security for Claude Code sandbox with trusted domains and firewall rules.
output: Trusted Domains: api.anthropic.com, github.com, npmjs.org, pypi.org, docker.io
DNS Filtering: Enabled with private IP blocking

best_practices: Use whitelist approach - deny all traffic by default and explicitly allow trusted domains
Implement rate limiting to prevent abuse and protect external API endpoints
Regularly audit and update trusted domains as project requirements evolve
anti_patterns: Using blacklist approach instead of whitelist for network security
Allowing all outbound traffic without restrictions
Not testing firewall rules before deployment

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code on all platforms.

faq.question: What ports should I allow?
faq.answer: Allow outbound 80, 443, 22 and inbound 3000, 5000, 8000, 8080 for development.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Save policy JSON files to version control and apply them during deployment pipeline.

faq.question: Is my data sent externally?
faq.answer: This skill only configures policies. No data is sent externally by the skill itself.

faq.question: What if network tests fail?
faq.answer: Check firewall rules allow the port, verify domain spelling, and ensure rate limits are not exceeded.

faq.question: How is this different from cloud security groups?
faq.answer: This skill configures sandbox-level isolation. Use with cloud security groups for defense in depth.
